metadata:
pandas Python Library DataFrame Library Version: 1.0.5. pandas is an open source library providing high-performance, easy-to-use data structures and data analysis tools for the Python programming language. DataFrame is a two-dimensional, size-mutable, potentially heterogeneous tabular data.
2020-06-17 https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/reference/index.html BSD-3-Clause License
matplotlib Python Library John D. Hunter and Open Source Contributers: https://github.com/matplotlib/matplotlib/tree/v3.3.3 Library Version: 3.3.3. Used for plotting histograms and scatterplots 2020-11-12 IEEE COMPUTER SOC https://matplotlib.org/3.3.3/contents.html MIT License
statsmodels: Econometric and statistical modeling with Python Seabold, Skipper and Perktold, Josef Library Version: v0.12.1. classes and functions for the estimation of many different statistical models, as well as for conducting statistical tests, and statistical data exploration.
2020-08-29 https://www.statsmodels.org/stable/index.html#index--page-root BSD (3-clause) license
scikit-learn Python Library Pedregosa, F. and Varoquaux, G. and Gramfort, A. and Michel, V. and Thirion, B. and Grisel, O. and Blondel, M. and Prettenhofer, P. and Weiss, R. and Dubourg, V. and Vanderplas, J. and Passos, A. and Cournapeau, D. and Brucher, M. and Perrot, M. and Duchesnay, E. Open Source contributions: https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn> Library Version 1.0.0. Simple and efficient tools for predictive data analysis scikit-learn developers (BSD License)> https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn BSD (3-clause) license
trees_by_zip.csv Dataset Column Variables Team 8 Column 1: zipcode Column 2: number_of_trees Column 1: All NYC zipcodes. Integer datatype
Column 2: Tree count density. Number of trees recorded in each particular NYC zip code marked area. Integer datatype
None
property_value_by_zip.csv Dataset Column Variables Team 8 Column 1: zipcode Column 2: mean Column 3: median Column 4: min Column 5: max Column 6: count Column 1: All NYC zipcodes. Integer datatype
Column 2: Mean property valuation recorded for each particular NYC zip code marked area. Float datatype
Column 3: Median property valuation recorded for each particular NYC zip code marked area. Float datatype
Column 4: Minimum property valuation recorded for each particular NYC zip code marked area. Float datatype
Column 5: Maximum property valuation recorded for each particular NYC zip code marked area. Float datatype
Column 6: Number of recorded property valuations in each particular NYC zip code marked area. Integer datatype
None
species_by_zip.csv Dataset Column Variables Team 8 Column 1: zipcode Column 2 - 133: Species Column 1: All NYC zipcodes. Integer datatype
Column 2 - 133: There are 132 different species of trees recorded in the NYC Tree Census data. Each column represents the number trees of that particular species recorded for the zipcodes in "zipcodes" column. Integer datatype
None
zipcodes.csv Dataset Column Variables Team 8 Column 1: zipcode Column 2: number_of_trees Column 3: mean_property_value Column 4: zipcode Column 5 - 136: Species Column 1: All NYC zipcodes. Integer datatype
Column 2: Number of trees for each NYC zip code. Integer datatype
Column 3: Mean property valuation recorded for each particular NYC zip code marked area. Float datatype
Column 4: NYC zipcodes. Comes from the merging of species_by_zip.csv and property_value_by_zip.csv. Integer datatype
Column 5 - 136 : There are 132 different species of trees recorded in the NYC Tree Census data. Each column represents the number trees of that particular species recorded for the zipcodes in "zipcodes" column. Integer datatype
None
